file_content.text: Who are you?
Good to see you back, Cipher Nine.
Good day, agent.
Oh--hello. Sorry, I ah--I didn't expect you to come over.
You're the field agent from Hutta, right? I'm--I'm Watcher Three.
Pleasure to meet you, Watcher Three.
Hello.
And you. Watcher Two said you've been performing admirably, especially for a junior agent.
Not that I mean any disrespect--I'm not one to talk about seniority, here. I've only been Watcher Three for six months.
How'd you end up working with Imperial Intelligence?
What's your story?
They recruited me--I used to work under the Ministry of Logistics, managing HoloNet security.
Intelligence wasn't exactly my dream job, but I wasn't going to turn Keeper down.
Is there some sort of problem? Am I bothering you?
You sound nervous.
Sorry. That's why I'm here instead of in the field--not so good with people.
Surprised I even got a Watcher designation. If I can manage it, I'm sure you'll get a title soon.
No one's ever explained how the designations work.
What are the titles?
Keeper assigns the categories. Watchers analyze data, monitor targets. Minders handle internal security. Ciphers are our infiltrators. You get the idea.
The number is just to identify individuals--it's not a rank, really. Of course, there's only one Keeper.
How many Watchers are there, anyway?
Tell me more about Watchers.
Only Keeper knows for sure. I've never met a Watcher with a designation higher than four.
Watcher One's on assignment right now, so it's just me and Watcher Two here.
Keeper's not fond of me. I won't be getting a title anytime soon.
Not with my luck.
Keeper's not fond of anyone. The day I arrived, he and Watcher Two were interrogating my predecessor--the last Watcher Three.
He'd worked with Keeper for years. He wanted to resign. It... didn't go over well.
Anyway, I should get back to work. I'm on surveillance duty, and I don't want to miss anything.
Good man. Make sure that you don't.
Excellent.
Goodbye.
Whatever you say.
Of course. I won't keep you.
